Package com.flynnbuc.httpserverwrapper.main

Class JSONServerController

java.lang.Object
com.flynnbuc.httpserverwrapper.main.ServerController<org.json.JSONObject>
com.flynnbuc.httpserverwrapper.main.JSONServerController
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.util.EventListener
public class JSONServerController
extends ServerController<org.json.JSONObject>

Defines a basic controller for ServerService.
If a class has dynamically generated handlers, those can be added by adding this class as a PropertyChangeListener, and firing a propertyChangeEvent.
In this case, evt.getPropertyName should be this.PROPERTY_CHANGE_STR, and evt.newValue should be an instance of Handler

    • handleRequestResponse

      public void handleRequestResponse​(long requestNum, org.json.JSONObject response, int responseCode)
      Function to be called to handle response to the user after the data has been processed by ContextManager
      Specified by:
      handleRequestResponse in class ServerController<org.json.JSONObject>
      Parameters:
      requestNum - id of the request that should be processed
      response - JSONObject representation of the request that should be sent back to client
      responseCode - int code for the response code sent in the headers

    • respondToRequest

      protected void respondToRequest​(org.json.JSONObject response, com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpExchange exchange, int responseCode)
      Respond to request by writing JSONObject to client
      Specified by:
      respondToRequest in class ServerController<org.json.JSONObject>
      Parameters:
      response - JSONObject containing the response
      exchange - HTTPExchange received from handler
      responseCode - response code received from listener

    • propertyChange

      public void propertyChange​(java.beans.PropertyChangeEvent evt)
      Adds a specified handler when a PropertyChangeEvent is fired
      Parameters:
      evt - event fired. To properly be added, evt.getPropertyName should be this.PROPERTY_CHANGE_STR, evt.getNewValue should be an instance of Handler
